summary: Tested Focus Plan V2 features: Example Position cycling, Last Game Audit, and User Thoughts API. All 11 backend tests pass. UI testing confirms example positions cycling with prev/next buttons works correctly. Fixed a bug where 'Open in Lab' button was navigating to /lab/{game_id} instead of /game/{game_id}.

verified: GET /api/focus-plan returns example_positions array in primary_focus
Array contains up to 5 positions with fen, move_number, cp_loss, move, best_move
Backwards compatible example_position (single) field also present
UI 'See Example Positions' button opens cycling panel
Prev/Next buttons work correctly to cycle through positions
Chessboard updates to show each position's FEN
Position info shows 'Example X of 5', Move number, cp_loss, you played/best move
Returns rules_audit array with rule text, status, and note for each rule
Violations array contains key moments to review with fen positions
UI Last Game Audit card displays opponent, overall status, rule audit with badges
Open in Lab button navigates to /game/{game_id} (fixed from /lab/{game_id})
POST /api/games/{game_id}/thought saves user thought with move_number, fen, thought_text
Endpoint returns success: true with thought_id
GET /api/games/{game_id}/thoughts returns all thoughts for a game
Thoughts can be updated if same move_number exists

bugs_fixed.issue: Open in Lab button was navigating to /lab/{game_id} which doesn't exist
bugs_fixed.fix: Changed to navigate to /game/{game_id} which is the correct route for the Lab component

seed_data_creation: Created test user thoughts via POST /api/games/{game_id}/thought endpoint
test_credentials: Use Dev Login button on landing page
context_for_next_testing_agent: Focus Plan V2 features complete. Example positions cycling allows users to view up to 5 positions from their primary focus area with prev/next navigation. Last Game Audit shows how well the user followed their 2 rules in their most recent game with executed/partial/missed status badges. User Thoughts API allows saving 'What were you thinking?' responses for each mistake in a game.
